      • moveCursor

        void moveCursor(Board.Direction dir)
        Moves the cursor in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to move in. Available values are NORTH, SOUTH, EAST and WEST.

      • moveCursor

        private void moveCursor(int deltaX,
                        int deltaY)
        Checks if the cursor can be moved in the given direction and moves it if that is the case.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - The X coordinate of the new tile, relative to the current tile
        deltaY - The Y coordinate of the new tile, relative to the current tile

        public Tile getCursorTile()
        Returns:

      • getTilesWithinMoveRange

        public java.util.Set<Tile> getTilesWithinMoveRange(Unit unit)
        Checks every tile that can be reached from a given tile, with the given movement range, and adds them to a set. You can move through allied units but not enemy units. You can still not stand on the same tile as a friendly unit.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit whose movement you want to check.
        Returns:
        A set containing every tile that the unit can reach.

      • calculateTiles

        private java.util.Set<Tile> calculateTiles(java.util.Set<Tile> tiles,
                                           Tile origin,
                                           Tile previous,
                                           Unit unit,
                                           int range)

      • getTilesAround

        public java.util.Set<Tile> getTilesAround(Tile center,
                                          int minRange,
                                          int maxRange)
        Returns the tiles that are at at least minRange steps away from the center tile but no more than maxRange steps away. Does not take tile movement costs into effect. For movement, see getTilesWithinMoveRange
        Parameters:
        center - The tile oyu want to get the surrounding tiles of.
        minRange - The minimum movement range to the returned tiles.
        maxRange - The maximum movement range to the returned tiles.
        Returns:
        A set containing all eligible tiles.
